Mesh module

Mesh generation and boundary management for 2D finite element problems.

This module provides utilities for creating triangular meshes for common geometries used in finite element simulations, together with helper functions for boundary label management compatible with NGSolve.

Main features

  • Rectangular domains with customizable boundary names

  • L-shaped (backward-facing step) benchmark domain

  • Utilities for extracting and composing boundary condition labels

mmfem.mesh.L_mesh(h)

Generate a triangular mesh for an L-shaped (backward-facing step) domain.

The domain is:

[0,10] × [-0.5,1] [0,4] × [-0.5,0]

This geometry is commonly used as a CFD benchmark and exhibits a re-entrant corner singularity.

Parameters:

h (float) – Maximum mesh size.

Returns:

NGSolve mesh with labeled boundaries: - “side” : wall boundaries - “flow_in” : inlet (x = 0) - “flow_out” : outlet (x = 10)

Return type:

Mesh

mmfem.mesh.boundary_string(mesh)[source]

Return boundary labels as a pipe-separated string.

This format is required by NGSolve for boundary condition specification.

Return type:

str

mmfem.mesh.get_boundary_labels(mesh)[source]

Return all boundary labels of a mesh.

Parameters:

mesh (Mesh) – NGSolve mesh object.

Returns:

Boundary labels.

Return type:

list of str

mmfem.mesh.get_dirichlet_boundaries(mesh, neumann_labels)[source]

Compute Dirichlet boundary labels by excluding Neumann boundaries.

Parameters:

  • mesh (Mesh) – NGSolve mesh object.

  • neumann_labels (str or list of str) – Boundary labels where Neumann conditions apply.

Returns:

Pipe-separated Dirichlet boundary labels.

Return type:

str

Raises:

ValueError – If any Neumann label is not found in the mesh.

mmfem.mesh.l_shaped_mesh(h)[source]

Generate a triangular mesh for an L-shaped (backward-facing step) domain.

The domain is:

[0,10] × [-0.5,1] [0,4] × [-0.5,0]

This geometry is commonly used as a CFD benchmark and exhibits a re-entrant corner singularity.

Parameters:

h (float) – Maximum mesh size.

Returns:

NGSolve mesh with labeled boundaries: - “side” : wall boundaries - “flow_in” : inlet (x = 0) - “flow_out” : outlet (x = 10)

Return type:

Mesh

mmfem.mesh.rectangle_mesh(x_min, x_max, y_min, y_max, h, boundary_names=None)[source]

Generate a triangular mesh for a rectangular domain [x_min, x_max] × [y_min, y_max].

Parameters:

  • x_min (float) – Left and right x-coordinates.

  • x_max (float) – Left and right x-coordinates.

  • y_min (float) – Bottom and top y-coordinates.

  • y_max (float) – Bottom and top y-coordinates.

  • h (float) – Maximum mesh size (element diameter).

  • boundary_names (dict, optional) – Mapping of boundary positions to labels. Allowed keys: {“bottom”, “right”, “top”, “left”}.

Returns:

NGSolve mesh with labeled boundaries.

Return type:

Mesh

Examples

>>> mesh = rectangle_mesh(0, 1, 0, 1, h=0.1)
>>> mesh.GetBoundaries()
('bottom', 'right', 'top', 'left')
